content.body: Ran into a web compat report yesterday where apparently if a domain looks like punycode (i.e. starts `xn--`) but isn't valid punycode, Chromium will just treat it as an ascii domain, but Gecko will refuse to resolve it. That seems like the kind of thing annevk probably knows about :)
content.formatted_body: Ran into a web compat report yesterday where apparently if a domain looks like punycode (i.e. starts xn--) but isn't valid punycode, Chromium will just treat it as an ascii domain, but Gecko will refuse to resolve it. That seems like the kind of thing annevk probably knows about :)

org.matrix.msc1767.message.body: Ran into a web compat report yesterday where apparently if a domain looks like punycode (i.e. starts `xn--`) but isn't valid punycode, Chromium will just treat it as an ascii domain, but Gecko will refuse to resolve it. That seems like the kind of thing annevk probably knows about :)

Ran into a web compat report yesterday where apparently if a domain looks like punycode (i.e. starts xn--) but isn't valid punycode, Chromium will just treat it as an ascii domain, but Gecko will refuse to resolve it. That seems like the kind of thing annevk probably knows about :)
